title: How has the work week changed over the past 100 years? - Quora

response.answer_text: By 1920 the industrial standard 40 hour week was well established. Of course, at that time only men were in the workforce. Since then there has been a slow trend away from firm standard work schedules because people aren’t uniform. A diverse workforce requires a diversity of schedules. It’s obvious that we can’t all work the same hours simply because we need each other’s professional services. I can’t use your services if you’re only available during my work hours. Somebody has to give. Some people have lives that don’t fit well with the standard work week. Parents, people with disabilities, and those with engaging hobbies may need certain times away from work. Supply and demand also play in scheduling workers.
